page.title: 04The Blacksmith
page.content:
Mr Pimm has been a blacksmith for 23 years and he has 1 assistant. His main work is shoeing horses and he shoes approximately 30 horses a week. Sometimes he has trouble with horses usually the thoroughbreds. As well as horse shoeing Mr Pimm makes gates and also many of his tools. His equipment is now modernised and he has electric bellows to heat the fire of coke. Half a ton of coke lasts roughly 3 months. He heats the coke until it is hot enough to turn the iron red. Then he puts the iron on to the anvil to beat it into shape. He uses hammers, tongs, pinchers etc to shape the iron.
By Jason Child and James Box
